1.description: Calibrates camera with white hexagon as user feedback.
1.user_instructions: Point the camera towards the ground and scan area until a white hexagon appears

2.description: Places lab on an acceptable user-chosen surface
2.user_instructions: Tap on the screen to place the lab onto the floor

3.description: Introduces user to the lab. Includes UI diagram of adjusting table size, rotation, and position.
3.directions: Welcome to the agarose gel electrophoresis  lab! In this short lab module we will be going through all the steps required to perform a successful agarose gel electrophoresis lab!

4.description: Guides the user to the inventory.
4.directions: First we need to take out all our required materials. We can do so by going to the inventory shown on the top right.

5.description: Guides the user to the electrophoresis tank.
5.directions: Great job! Now select the electrophoresis tank.

6.description: Guides the user to the gel comb.
6.directions: Good job. We also need some other materials to set up the tank. Select the gel comb.

7.description: Guides the user to the blockers.

8.description: Guides the user to the gel holder.
8.directions: Nice, our final setup equipment for the tank is the gel holder. Select that!

9.description: Guides the user to the 1% Agarose Solution.
9.directions: Now finally, we need the 1% agarose solution.

10.description: Confirms to the user that all materials have been gathered.
10.directions: Good selecting, scientist! Now that we have all the materials, we can set up the gel tank.

11.description: Guides user to place gel holder and blockers in the correct positions.
11.directions: Our first step would be to add the gel holder into the center of the tank and then place the blockers on the sides.

12.stepTitle: Directions on DNA Being Negatively Changed
12.description: Informs user on the negative charge of DNA.
12.directions: DNA is negatively charged which means that it would get sucked to the positive electrode. Therefore, in order for the DNA to show up in the gel, we need to make sure that the comb (in which we will eventually add in the DNA samples) is placed on the side of the NEGATIVE electrode.

13.description: Prompts user to place comb in the right location. TBA: include feedback if user places comb incorrectly on the positive end.
13.directions: Choose the correct location to place the comb.

14.description: Guides user to pour the agarose solution into the tank center.
14.directions: Great stuff! Now we can safely pour in the 1% agarose solution into the tank center.

15.description: Tells user to wait about 10 minutes for the gel to set in place.
15.directions: Now we wait for about 10 minutes for the gel to set before moving on to the next steps.

16.description: Prepares user to remove blockers and pour in buffer solution.
16.directions: Now that the gel is set, we pour in our buffer solution. Before we do that, we must remove the blockers so that the buffer can enter the tank.

17.description: Prompts user to open inventory and acquire buffer solution.
17.directions: Go to the inventory and get the buffer solution.

18.stepTitle: Open Inventory and Acquire Buffer Solution
18.description: Prompts user to open inventory and acquire buffer solution.
18.directions: Go to the inventory and get the buffer solution.

19.description: Prompts user to remove blockers from the gel tank.
19.directions: Before pouring in the buffer, we must make sure we remove the blockers.

20.description: Prompts user to press a button to fill up the tank with the buffer until the limit is reached. A checkmark icon appears when the limit is reached.
20.directions: Hold the "Fill up" button to pour in the buffer up to the limit.

21.description: Prompts user to remove comb from the gel tank.
21.directions: Great work, now we remove the comb and we are ready to fill in the DNA solution.

22.description: Tells user that 10uL of DNA solution is needed.
22.directions: On each comb, we need to fill about 10uL of DNA solution.

23.description: Prompts user to open inventory and acquire 10uL of DNA solution.
23.directions: Go to the inventory and choose the appropriate pipette to fill up 10 uL of DNA solution.

24.description: Prompts user to acquire mystery item from the inventory that goes with the pipette. This item is the pipette tip holder.
24.directions: Great! Is there anything else we need with the pipette?

25.description: Prompt user to use pipette with a tip to extract 10 uL of DNA solution and insert it into each hole created by the combs.
25.directions: Awesome stuff! Now we just extract 10 uL of the DNA sample and carefully insert it into each of the holes in the gel created by the combs.

26.description: Prompt user to use pipette with a tip to extract 10 uL of DNA solution and insert it into each hole created by the combs.
26.directions: Awesome stuff! Now we just extract 10 uL of the DNA sample and carefully insert it into each of the holes in the gel created by the combs.

27.description: Prompts user to use a joystick to move the pipette tip into the gel wall without breaking anything. A checkmark UI will appear once this is done.
27.directions: Now use the joystick on the right to move the pipette tip into the gel well without the tip hitting the edges.

28.description: Tells user that the power source should be attached now.
28.directions: That was amazing! Now we are ready to attach the power source to the tank and begin the electrophoresis process.

29.description: Prompts user to open the inventory and acquire the power source.
29.directions: Go to the inventory and select the power source.

30.description: Prompts user to attach the power source to the tank and switch it on.
30.directions: Great stuff! Now we attach the power source to the tank and switch it on.

31.description: Prompts user to set the voltage of the power source to 100 Volts. This is set through up and down arrow icons, and the user presses a running man icon to proceed once the voltage is correct.
31.directions: Set the voltage of the power source to 100 Volts. Hit the running man to start the power flow.

32.description: Tells user the lab is complete. A UI panel pops up on the screen saying the lab is complete after the next step button is pressed.
32.directions: That was fantastic! Now watch the gel electrophoresis unfold!
